newsitem.title: UK: NWE heating oil eases with buying interest thin.
newsitem.headline: NWE heating oil eases with buying interest thin.

text.p: NWE heating oil slid again on Friday as scant demand forced prices lower.
Barges traded weaker at June IPE +$1.50 and $1.25 a tonne fob Rotterdam, but traders said that buyers were still sticking to the sidelines in anticipation of further falls.
"If next week the market corrects down I think we'll see buying pick up," said one dealer.
Benchmark IPE gas oil futures also slipped $1.25 to close at $177.75 a tonne.
Traders said that slack demand from German householders was at the root of market weakness.
A 31,000 tonne Russian cargo already on the water traded steady on Thursday's levels at June IPE +$2.25 cif ARA.
EN590 barges traded at June IPE +$9.00 and +$9.50 fob Flushing, with cargoes offered at steady levels.
